data.enText: a small metal or plastic object used for holding things together or in place
a hair clip
toe clips on a bicycle
a piece of jewellery that fastens to your clothes
a diamond clip
the act of cutting sth to make it shorter
He gave the hedge a clip.
a short part of a film/movie that is shown separately

data.chText: 这是她最新电影的片段。
data.enText: Here is a clip from her latest movie.
a quick hit with your hand

data.chText: 她因他放肆给了他一记耳光。
data.enText: She gave him a clip round the ear for being cheeky.
a set of bullets in a metal container that is placed in or attached to a gun for firing
at a fast, good, steady, etc. clip
quickly
to fasten sth to sth else with a clip ; to be fastened with a clip

data.chText: 他把麦克风别在衣领上。
data.enText: He clipped the microphone (on) to his collar.
Clip the pages together .
Do those earrings clip on?
to cut sth with scissors or shears , in order to make it shorter or neater; to remove sth from somewhere by cutting it off
to clip a hedge
He clipped off a length of wire.

data.chText: 碰撞（某物的边缘或侧面）
data.enText: to hit the edge or side of sth

data.chText: 汽车转弯时撞上了路缘。
data.enText: The car clipped the kerb as it turned.
She clipped the ball into the net.
to cut sth out of sth else using scissors
to clip a coupon (out of the paper)
clip sb's wings

data.chText: 限制某人的自由（或权力）
data.enText: to restrict a person's freedom or power
clip sth off sth

data.chText: 缩短，削减（做某事的时间）
data.enText: to reduce the time that it takes to do sth by a particular length of time

data.chText: 她把自己之前的最佳纪录缩短了两秒。
data.enText: She clipped two seconds off her previous best time.

means: 碰撞(某物的边缘或侧面)

ex.zh: 录音/电影/音乐/录像短片
（可从杂志上剪下来的）优惠券

data.enText: at a fast, good, steady, etc. clip
quickly
clip sb's wings

data.chText: 限制某人的自由（或权力）
data.enText: to restrict a person's freedom or power
clip sth off sth

data.chText: 缩短，削减（做某事的时间）
data.enText: to reduce the time that it takes to do sth by a particular length of time

data.chText: 她把自己之前的最佳纪录缩短了两秒。
data.enText: She clipped two seconds off her previous best time.

example: he gave me a clip on the ear

tr: the act of clipping or snipping
a metal frame or container holding cartridges
can be inserted into an automatic gun
any of various small fasteners used to hold loose articles together
an article of jewelry that can be clipped onto a hat or dress
an instance or single occasion for some event
example: he could do ten at a clip

tr: terminate or abbreviate before its intended or proper end or its full extent
example: Personal freedom is curtailed in many countries

tr: cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of
example: dress the plants in the garden

tr: sever or remove by pinching or snipping
run at a moderately swift pace

value.def: A clip is a small device, usually made of metal or plastic, that is specially shaped for holding things together.

example.ex: She took the clip out of her hair.

value.def: When you clip things together or when things clip together, you fasten them together using a clip or clips.

example.ex: He clipped his safety belt to a fitting on the deck...
example.tran: 他把安全带夹在甲板的一个固定装置上。

example.ex: He clipped his cufflinks neatly in place.
example.tran: 他把袖扣别得整整齐齐。

example.ex: ...an electronic pen which clips to the casing...
His flashlight was still clipped to his belt.
example.tran: 他的手电筒还别在皮带上。

value.def: A clip from a film or a radio or television programme is a short piece of it that is broadcast separately.

example.ex: ...an historical film clip of Lenin speaking.
example.tran: 一段列宁在讲话的历史电影片段
电影《原野奇侠》的一段剪辑

value.tran: (电影、广播或电视节目的)剪辑，片段

value.def: If you clip something, you cut small pieces from it, especially in order to shape it.

example.ex: I saw an old man out clipping his hedge...
example.tran: 我看见一位老人在外面修剪树篱。

example.ex: He had already clipped his hair close to the skull.
example.tran: 他已经把头发剪得贴头皮了。
对树篱进行最后的修剪。

value.tran: (尤指为使某物成形而)修剪，剪

value.def: If you clip something out of a newspaper or magazine, you cut it out.

example.ex: Kids in his neighborhood clipped his picture from the newspaper and carried it around.
example.tran: 附近的孩子们从报纸上剪下他的照片，到哪儿都带着。

value.def: If something clips something else, it hits it accidentally at an angle before moving off in a different direction.

example.ex: The lorry clipped the rear of a tanker and then crashed into a second truck.
example.tran: 大货车斜撞上一辆油罐车的尾部，接着又撞上了另一辆货车。

value.def: If you give someone a clip round the ear, you hit their head fairly lightly with the palm of your hand, usually as a punishment.

example.ex: The boy was later given a clip round the ear by his father.
example.tran: 后来男孩被父亲打了一耳光。

value.tran: (通常指作为惩罚的)耳光，抽打

value.def: If you clip a small amount off the time taken to do something, you reduce it by that amount.

example.ex: Boardman finished in 1hr 43mins, clipping 49 seconds from his own course record.
example.tran: 博德曼完成全程用时1小时43分，把自己的赛道纪录缩短了49秒。

value.def: An ammunition clip is a metal container on an automatic weapon which holds ammunition.
If something moves or happens at a fast clip, it moves or happens quickly.

example.ex: They moved out from the airport at a brisk clip...
Studios are releasing movies at a fast clip.
example.tran: 电影制片公司发行新片的速度很快。

trans: 短片；录像片段；千年恋歌；视频短片；骇人手机
剪贴画(计算机程序或网站中供用户复制自用的图像和符号)
金属夹；软管固定夹；叉字铁夹
